[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Document Sheet System (DSS) defines requirements for managing sheets, text, and geometric objects.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DSS supports document creation, multi-sheet management, text editing, and geometric operations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DSS integrates with document storage, rendering engines, and collaboration tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DSS provides an interactive UI for editing sheets and objects.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DSS supports desktops and tablets with touch and stylus input.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DSS uses PostgreSQL  REST APIs for object manipulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DSS secures collaboration via TLS  OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DSS optimizes storage for large documents  object handling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DSS supports real-time editing  auto-saving  rollback.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DSS supports cloud/on-premise deployment with access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DSS integrates with cloud storage  external collaboration tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DSS manages text  objects  and operations like copy  cut  paste  move  resize.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DSS serves document creators  graphic designers  editors  illustrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DSS requires internet for real-time collaboration  syncing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DSS relies on secure storage  rendering engines  authentication  document access controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with document storage for saving  retrieving sheets (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall expose REST APIs for text  object manipulation (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support selection  copy  cut  paste  move  resize operations for text  objects (REQ-DB-001  REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to insert  modify  remove rectangles  circles  grouped elements (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an editor with drag-and-drop  shortcuts  object snapping.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process object actions within 2 seconds under normal usage.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store sheets  text  associated metadata.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track geometric objects  including position  size  transformations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support real-time updates  undo  redo  versioning.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with document security  role-based access  encryption protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log object modifications  text changes  user actions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests sheet creation  text editing  object manipulation  storage retrieval.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides  API documentation  collaboration manuals  data security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Document management policies  industry security regulations  usability standards.
